name: Functional, standard, unobstructive YouTube player
description:
Proper screenshot: http://imgur.com/nxVXsar
WARNING: This is just to show how it looks! It doesn't seem to work well in Chrome at all! This style is actually kind of crap until someone codes it properly (you're free). It only works in Theater Mode too, as I couldn't bother to make it for normal mode. YouTube is soon redesign its look, so this will soon go in the trash too, but look how AMAZING it has been looking! Isn't it awesome?
additional_info:
- The controls are always available/visible. If there's ground for hiding them, then why doesn't YouTube auto-hide the rest of the elements on the page too!? Irrational. The progress bar still needs mouse-over ( go ahead, fix it);
- The controls don't cover the videos. You're supposed to see the videos, not have something obstructing them!
- The video is consistently put inside the standard  box with margins like everything else on the page is. Why would the video be a random element floating on emptiness?
- The controls are faster! Every brand is purposely doing things slower nowadays, but not here! I removed as many slowing transitions as I could. You put the mouse over, it pops up immediately -- no waiting for time consuming fade-ins.

Fix this style up if you know how and enjoy it.
